intro: Flemingia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Flemingia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately compound, and have a slender, linear shape. Flemingia angustifolia is known for its small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value in tropical gardens.
